flavor_text_entries.flavor_text:
湿地帯に　生える　木に巻きつき
甘い香りの　だえきで　獲物を
誘き寄せては　ひとくちで　食べる。

It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey
with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

Si attacca agli alberi nelle paludi. Attrae le prede con il dolce
aroma della saliva e poi le ingoia.

Se cuelga de los árboles en los pantanos. Atrae a sus presas
con su dulce olor y las engulle.

Klammert sich an Bäume in Sümpfen. Lockt Beute mit seinem
süßlichen Speichel an und schluckt sie dann.

Il s’accroche aux arbres des marais et attire ses proies avec
sa salive à l’odeur enivrante.

늪지대에서 자라는 나무에 엉겨 붙어
달콤한 냄새의 타액으로 먹이를
끌어들여 한입에 먹는다.

しっちたいに　はえる　きにまきつき
あまいかおりの　だえきで　えものを
おびきよせては　ひとくちで　たべる。

甘い　においの　だえきで　獲物を
おびき寄せ　おおあごで　がぶり。
１日　かけて　獲物を　食べる。

It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then
chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

Attira le prede con il dolce aroma della saliva e poi le ingoia.
Impiega un giorno per mangiare una preda.

Atrae a sus presas con saliva de olor dulce y las mastica.
Tarda todo un día en comérselas.

Sein süßlich riechender Speichel zieht Beute an, die es frisst.
Es braucht einen Tag, sie zu fressen.

Il attire sa proie avec sa salive odorante avant de la croquer.
Il lui faut une journée pour l’avaler.

달콤한 냄새의 타액으로 먹이를
끌어들여 큰 턱으로 꿀꺽한다.
하루에 걸쳐 먹이를 먹는다.

あまい　においの　だえきで　えものを
おびきよせ　おおあごで　がぶり。
１にち　かけて　えものを　たべる。

Using its tentacles to lash itself to
trees, it lies in wait for prey, luring it
close with sweet-smelling drool.

Using its tentacles to lash itself to
trees, it lies in wait for prey, luring it
close with sweet-smelling drool.

It binds itself to trees in marshes.
It attracts prey with its sweet-
smelling drool and gulps them down.

Il s’accroche aux arbres des
marais et attire ses proies avec
sa salive à l’odeur enivrante.

It binds itself to trees in marshes.
It attracts prey with its sweet-
smelling drool and gulps them down.

Il s’accroche aux arbres des
marais et attire ses proies avec
sa salive à l’odeur enivrante.

It walks around on its tentacles in
search of a tree branch where it
can dangle down and ambush prey.

It walks around on its tentacles in
search of a tree branch where it
can dangle down and ambush prey.

It binds itself to trees in marshes.
It attracts prey with its sweet-
smelling drool and gulps them down.

Hanging from branches using its
tentacles, it looks like a plant.
It awaits prey, mouth wide open.

It attracts prey with its sweet-
smelling saliva, then chomps down.
It takes a whole day to eat prey.
